pullRequest.body:
The main result in this PR is that a commutative square `sq : Square C` is a pullback square iff it is mapped to a pullback square in the category of types when we apply the functor `coyoneda.obj X` for any `X : Cáµ’áµ–`. In order to do this, it is shown that the proprety `Square.IsPullback` is preserved when a functor preserving this pullback is applied. A similar result is obtained for pushout squares, which required developing the "opposites" API for squares. 

---

- [x] depends on: #15157

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10165971223/job/28115034049)

Doesn't this follow from the fact that `yoneda` preserves & reflects limits and that limits in functor categories can be checked pointwise? Is it possible to specialize these results to `IsPullback` and get this lemma?
I have developped the API in #15157.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): preservation of pullback/pushout squares
